message.content:
Did you know that around the year 1900, the Qing Dynasty ruled over China? Let's dig in 🧵

The Qing Dynasty was a monarchy, ruled by the Manchu ethnic minority. Confucianism was the dominant religion and Mandarin Chinese was the official language. #QingDynasty #China 🇨🇳

Emperor Guangxu was an influential figure during this time. He attempted to modernize China by implementing reforms such as establishing a constitutional monarchy and modernizing the military. #EmperorGuangxu #Reforms

The Qing Dynasty's influence on modern day China is vast. They ruled for over 250 years and their legacy can still be seen in China's government and cultural practices. #Influence #China 🇨🇳

One controversial practice during this time was foot binding, which was practiced by the upper class. It was a painful and dangerous practice that resulted in deformed feet. #FootBinding #Controversial

The Qing Dynasty came to an end in 1912, after a series of rebellions and revolutions. The last emperor, Puyi, abdicated the throne and China became a republic. #EndOfQingDynasty #RepublicOfChina 🇨🇳

Hope you enjoyed learning about the Qing Dynasty! See you next time 👋 Follow @HistoryOfCiv for more on past civilizations. #QingDynasty #China 🇨🇳
